question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: expect_complete_result()] [Panic on incomplete state] Can expect_complete_result() at line 108 be reached through error recovery paths where the result is legitimately incomplete, causing unnecessary validator panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: get_complete_result()] [Resource exhaustion] Can repeated calls to get_complete_result() with its expensive clones at lines 97-102 be used to exhaust validator memory, especially if called in loops during state sync or block processing? [File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Function: new()] [Initialization validation] Does new() at line 25 perform any validation of the provided execution_output, or can corrupted/malicious ExecutionOutput instances be wrapped without detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor/src/types/partial_state_compute_result.rs] [Struct: PartialStateComputeResult] [Byzantine validator attack] Can a Byzantine validator (< 1/3) craft a PartialStateComputeResult with valid execution_output but malicious state_checkpoint_output that produces a different state root, causing honest validators to reject the block?
